Reviews.Content: Very good for the price... In spite of the reviews, this is actually quite a good hotel. The majority of the chain hotels in Frankfurt are in the Bahnhofsviertel, which is fine, if thats where you want to be and want to walk through the Red Light District for dinner. This hotel is situated about 5 minutes walk along a main street from the Zeil which I think makes it a fantastic location on the eastern side of the city centre.At the beginning of the Zeil is the Konstablerwache U-Bahn station which makes it easy to get to the airport/Wiesbaden etc. I also think that one of it's selling points is being able to walk over the river into Sachsenhausen of an evening!Check-in staff were helpful with directions etc (all speaking english), and a fax that I had to send. We had booked a special deal for one of the top floor rooms, and this was an average room that perfectly suited its purpose of a 1 night stay. The American Bar is also a great place in the evenings!I am not sure if I would pay the prices for the 'better' rooms here, solely because the hotel is only 3*. It's not somewhere that I would book to impress. However, check the Steigenberger website for special deals, there is generally some if you book ahead.
Reviews.Author: mrbaggers

Reviews.Content: unfriendly desk clerk My wife and I stayed at the hotel from 22 to 30 November 2007 and again from 8 to 10 December 2007. During our first stay in november we had only one problem, room not properly cleaned and dirty glasses not replaced. This was reported to the front desk TWICE before any action was taken. Otherwise our stay was very pleasanrt and the staff were friendly and hlepful.The hotel advertises on their website, and in their general brochure in the room, that they provide a luggage service. This was very important to me as I had major back surgery this year and was not able to handle any heavy luggage. I took this into account when I made my reservation. During our November stay we had excellent assistance ffrom the staff and there was no problem when we asked for assistance with our luggage.Even when we checked in for our second stay on 8th December, after returning from Munich,we were assisted with our luggage. However, when I called the desk for assistance, as we were checking out on 10 December (also our last stay of a very memorable 18 day stay in Germany), I was told by the desk clerk, a Herr Hennemann, that the hotel does not provide a luggage service and that I would have to collect the trolleys in the foyer and move our lugagge on ourselves. I pointed out to him that I have a back problem and that the hotel brochure and the internet website stated that a luggage service is available, he told me that this information was incorrect and I would have to do the luggage myself.I went down to the front desk and showed him the hotel brochure where it clearly states luggage service provided but he still would not budge and insisted that it was a printing error. I told him that, due to my back problem, I would never have booked the hotel if they did not provide this service and also referred to my previous stay at the hotel in November where we were assisted without any problem. I had booked this hotel because I had stayed there on a previous occasion in 2005 without any problems.I then asked herr Hennemann for the trolleys, which he had to go look for as they were not in the foyer as he had stated. His attitude was also not becoming of a hotel employee and his manner of telling me about the luggage was totally unacceptable. I put this to him very strongly and also told him that I would lodge a written complaint with the hotel and the Germany Embassy in Cape Town.When he eventually returned with the ttrolleys he offerred to help us but I refused bacause of his totally unacceptable attitude and told him that we did not want any special favours from him. He told me that he had checked with his manager who confirmed that the hotel does not provide a luggage service.My contention is that they should not advertise services, on their website and in-house brochure, that they know they do not provide! Or is herr Hennemann making his own rules for the hotel without the knowledge of management and those who are responsible for advertising?This incident was really a sour ending to a lovely 18 day holiday in Germany and herr Hennemann was the only hotel employee who treated us in this manner during our entire trip.John  Agatha ThomasCape Town South Africa
Reviews.Author: moorcres

Reviews.Content: OK hotel, lovely food, dodgy location Ok - for the postivie sides of this hotel: the food at the restaurant,although a wee bit pricey was just delicious. the breakfast was also pretty good. onsite parking available, although expensive, and location was very close to the centre, although in a dodgier area. Theroom was pretty sufficient although the bathroom could've been cleaner. The service was friendly, flexible and very helpful. Overall,a convenient hotel in Frankfurt
Reviews.Author: Hypnos

Reviews.Content: Not the best 4 star hotel Stayed at the hotel for 1 night from the 03dec-04dec and was not impressed. Rooms are small with a very small bathroom with only a shower and a toilet. The sink is situated outside the bathroom next to a closet. During Christmas there is a christmas market nearby and that is the only advantage that i could find. Cannot recommend this as a 4 star hotel.
Reviews.Author: ClausP

Reviews.Content: I'm sure you can find better First, the good. The location is okay...close to the river and easy walk if going to Sachsenhausen. Room was clean and not overly cramped. The food offered on the buffet breakfast is good and worth the cost for us.Now, the not so good. This hotel mentions that it has a gym but it is a complete joke. Almost completely unusable as most of the equipment is old and dis-functional. The bad part of location is that it is not at all close to the U-bahn. It is roughly equal distance between two stations but not at all close. There is a trolley that runs along the road and my room did face that road. That noise did not bother me but the noise from drunks returning from their evening out did.Finally, I had some cleaning done by the hotel. I was missing one item and mentioned it to the staff. Their response was that it must be my mistake and that I did not count correctly. No offer was made to make it right. So much for the customer always being right.I won't be staying here again.
Reviews.Author: RaleighTraveldude

Reviews.Content: Very comfortable, convenient location, good all around Just finished a 3-night stay here, for a business trip outside Frankfurt; we were interested in staying in town to enjoy some sightseeing and have access to Frankfurt restaurants. Very satisfied here. The room was comfortable: firm mattress, great shower, well lit. Good-performing Wi-Fi available at 鈧?/day (some hotels in Europe charge much more). They have off-street parking available. Rooms were in the 鈧?00 ballpark (I think we paid 95 on Sunday night and 113 the other nights). Breakfast buffet was excellent; typical selection of cold meats, cheese, smoked fish, yogurt, cereals, juices, etc., plus English breakfast (eggs, sausages, broiled tomatoes, baked beans). The Sachsenhausen area is a short walk, as is the Dom and the adjacent Roman foundations. Didn't take the U-bahn; I think the closest station is by the Dom (so, maybe a 7-minute walk?).
Reviews.Author: ChipSet

Reviews.Content: very average hotel but uncomfortable neighborhood we stayed at the Steigenberger city for two nights, we picked it based on a pretty cheap price and good reviews. overall the hotel was decent in pretty much every way.the location of the hotel seemed good on the map, but having never been to the city I was a bit surprised by the neighborhood. while finding our way towards the Zeil in the evening we stumbled across some very shabby streets with odd looking bars and not too friendly looking people, drunks and other odd characters. we also stumbled across the 'City Hotel' of which you can read some pretty interesting stories about in regards of the neighborhood. the walk to Zeil in the end wasn't more than five minutes but I would rather make it from a different direction.with the location being the worst detail, the hotel itself was ok with decent rooms, nothing fancy but ok for the price. hallways were extremely washed out and musky, rooms were definately cleaner and nicer. staff was friendly and the hotel restaurant was a positive surprise for a late night snack. it was also our only hope since there were absolutely no places to get food nearby.overall not much to complain about the place itself, more about the surroundings which felt a bit uncomfortable especially during weekend nights. if I'd come to the city again, I would definately pick a hotel located somewhere else around the downtown area.
Reviews.Author: Shoemakerluis

Reviews.Content: Excellent value We got a great price on this property, via Travelocity. We were quite jetlagged from our trans-Atlantic flight, but the staff immediately made us at ease, addressing any and all questions we asked. Parking is convenient and attached, for a nominal fee. Staff speaks excellent English. The location of the property, near Sachsenhausen, many museums, and Roemerberg, is its main strength...much to see, do, and eat within walking distance. Rooms are appointed well and are very comfortable.
Reviews.Author: pjnvikes

Reviews.Content: Excelent Hotel We just returned from 4 nights, 26th July to 30th July. (We travelled From Edinburgh for a city break).We flew into the airport and via the hotel our city break started in style, we were picked up in a limousine, door to door service.The hotel is super, as the say very staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was very nice; we were on the L wing which was very quite. We rated the breakfast as the best we have had in a hotel for years!We rate this as hotel as highly recommended excellent value for money.
Reviews.Author: SPARK57

Reviews.Content: Good hotel, desk staff unhelpful This is a clean, decently appointed hotel. It was close to the river which was nice, but not close enough to public transportation for me. We arrived early in the day (before noon) and had no problem checking in. The only negative I have is that you can't rely on the front desk staff for any type of direction or information. They were most un-helpful but despite that I would reccomend a stay here.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Steingenberger City - disappointing for the price to say the least... The hotel has a very late check in so when we arrived at 1.30 our rooms were still not ready and we had a wait of nearly an hour before getting into them. We then had a further wait of several hours before they could correct one of the double rooms which was supposed to be a twin. We went out while they sorted it and on our return were given exactly the same room!! In the end we were given what appeared to be a disabled double room on the ground floor, where half the bed had been moved over to the other side of the room (away from the bedside table and light) to look like a twin room. Not a very good start.Others have mentioned the breakfast buffet with delight but hard bread and tea made with warm water appeared to be included during our stay.The rooms are adequate for a business style hotel but the service leaves a lot to be desired. The staff were snippy to say the least and on the morning of check out it was impossible to get an answer from the desk to calls from our room. Considering the price we paid for the rooms we were rather disappointed.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Good value Good value hotel with clean rooms and convenient location. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. We had our dinner in the hotel restaurant - the service was inadequate even though there were only three tables at that time. We had to wait quite a while for the waiter for ordering and for the check. The food was average.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Good value, good location, good shopping! I booked the Steigenberger Maxx on the strength of a satisfying stay at the Steigenberger Airport Hotel last September when I was bumped off a Lufthansa flight from Lisbon. The Airport Hotel had probably the best and most extensive breakfast buffet I'd ever seen. Though not quite as extensive, the downtown Maxx hotel certainly offers variety enough for most tastes. My single room was large, clean and had internet access for those so inclined. Not to mention, the hotel is easy to reach by train -- the nearest station is just 6 stops on the S8 Line from Frankfurt Airport. Nearby Zeil offers a range of shopping opportunities, along with restaurants and grocery stores (located in the basement of department stores) if you fancy a picnic near the water. Located close by is McGowan's Irish Pub -- a friendly Irish oasis where you'll find Irish and English expats hobnobbing with locals keen on practicing their English. Very enjoyable -- and great if you're craving pub food.
Reviews.Author: TravellerfromTO

Reviews.Content: Best Breakfast Buffet Around Modern business style hotel close to town center, easy walking distance. Rooms are nice, clean, but pretty ordinary business type. They let us check in at 8 a.m. when our flight arrived really early. The metal window blinds (jalousinen) really helped us with our nap. They have the most comprehensive breakfast buffet I've seen. They have everything, and five kinds of each everything. They do indeed have parking, though before you've checked in it's difficult to know that you can just pull up and use the intercom to tell them you want to get in. The lot behind the hotel (access from the front) is easier to maneuver in than the below-ground lot (access on the side).
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Wonderful! The Steigenberger Maxx hotel is wonderful. The single rooms are spacious and the staff are friendly and helpful. I would recommend it to both business and pleasure travellers.The only bad point is that you have to walk 10-15 mins to the nearest U-bahn (unless you are patient enough to get a connecting S-bahn).
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
